name: rehang
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to remove something that is hanging and then hang it again: I rehung the door so that it opened outwards. I had to rehang my muffler to keep the cold out.
to change the arrangement of the paintings or pictures on the walls of a room: The only change the new curator made was to re-hang some of the paintings. A group of artists was invited to rehang the museum's permanent collection.
to remove wallpaper from a wall and then hang it on the wall again: She told the decorators that they would have to re-hang the Japanese wallpaper. I'd like to re-hang the wallpaper where the door used to be.
More examplesFewer examplesIt can hard for an elderly person to take down and re-hang curtains.His job was to repair the fences and rehang the gates.Every autumn I completely rehang the gallery.
